docs.snippet: Major League Baseball has approved a padded cap for pitchers, but Brandon McCarthy, whose injury spurred the design, said he would not use it....
docs.lead_paragraph: Major League Baseball has approved a padded cap for pitchers, but Brandon McCarthy, whose injury spurred the design, said he would not use it.
docs.abstract: Major League Baseball approves a padded cap to protect pitchers from line drives, but Arizona Diamondbacks pitcher Brandon McCarthy, whose injury spurred the design, says he will not use it.

headline.main: Pitcher Refuses to Wear Cap That His Injury Helped to Bring About
headline.print_headline: Pitcher Rejects Cap Made in Response to His Injury

docs.snippet: Aware of litigation against Major League Baseball, the N.F.L. this year hired some paid workers for positions normally filled by volunteers, making some wonder why it is not paying all of the workers....
docs.lead_paragraph: Aware of litigation against Major League Baseball, the N.F.L. this year hired some paid workers for positions normally filled by volunteers, making some wonder why it is not paying all of the workers.
docs.abstract: NFL has opted to hire some 1,500 temporary Super Bowl workers for positions that have traditionally been filled by enthusiastic volunteers, citing anxiety over ongoing litigation against Major League Baseball; league still expects to use as many as 9,000 volunteers, down from initial estimate of 20,000.

headline.main: The Price for Super Bowl Volunteers

docs.snippet: The former Wildcats quarterback Kain Colter joined executives of the newly formed College Athletes Players Association and the United Steel Workers in order to be granted “a seat at the table.”...
docs.lead_paragraph: The former Wildcats quarterback Kain Colter joined executives of the newly formed College Athletes Players Association and the United Steel Workers in order to be granted “a seat at the table.”
docs.abstract: Group of football players from Northwestern University appeal to the National Labor Relations Board with the first effort by college athletes to join a labor union; labor law dispute could turn on whether college athletes are students, employees or some hybrid.

headline.main: In a First, Northwestern Players Seek Unionization
headline.print_headline: In a First, Northwestern Players Seek Unionization
